intro: Galianthe vasquezii, commonly known as the Vásquez's galianthe, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, temperate climates with well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the spring and early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
